description.narrative: The project aims to promote enhanced use and quality of arbitration and mediation in Georgia through strengthening capacities of relevant institutions.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1/ The law on Mediation adopted 1.2/ Mediation centres established in district/city courts outside Tbilisi 1.3/ Awareness about mediation and arbitration increased 2.1/ Training modules on ADRs developed for Georgian Bar Association lawyers and introduced in the GBA continuous legal education programme 2.2/ Syllabus on ADR schemes developed and introduced in High Educational Institution 2.3/ Practice-oriented manuals for judges and court staff developed and introduced through High School Of Justice

comment.narrative:
1.1/ The draft law is being finalized by the Ministry of Justice 1.2/ Previously volunteer-based Gori mediation centre is not functioning. There are no mediation centres outside Tbilisi 1.3.1/ Baseline data on awareness rates of business will be measured at the beginning of the project implementation 1.3.2/ <115 in-court mediation between 2014-2017 1.3.3/ <10 business to business arbitration until 2017
2.1/ 875 GBA lawyers have been trained in 2016-2017 2.2/ Mediation is introduced in curricula of Tbilisi universities only. None of the High Educational Institutions from regions have courses on ADR 2.3.1/ 35 representatives of the judiciary were trained in 2016-2017 2.3.2/ Baseline data not available

1.1/ The law on mediation is adopted by the Parliament of Georgia 1.2/ 4 locations for mediations centres are identified in cooperation with High Council of Justice and trainees are selected locally for mediators’ certification training. 1.3.1/ Survey on ADR awareness among businesses conducted 1.3.2/ at least 70 in-court mediation cases in 2019 1.3.3/ at least 4 business to business arbitration cases in 2019 2.1/ at least 400 Georgian Bar Association members trained in ADR (at least 50% women) 2.2/ Regional University for piloting ADR course is identified. Model Syllabus is elaborated 2.3.1. at least 30% of Civil Law Chamber l law specialization judges and their assistants are trained on ADR (at least 40% of trainees are women) 2.3.2. Identify the necessity of High School of Justice regarding the practice oriented manuals

1.1/ Law on Mediation adopted by the Parliament of Georgia 1.2/ 4 preliminary locations for mediation centers to be launched in 2020 were agreed: Batumi, Kutaisi, Bolnisi and Telavi. The agreement will be formalized through adoption of Court Mediation Programme. Mediators Training for Batumi and Kutaisi was successfully conducted. 1.3.1/Survey on ADR among businesses and citizens conducted in 2019, the report will be published in early 2020. 1.3.2/ 46 in-court mediation cases in 2019 1.3.3/ 7 business to business arbitration cases in 2019 2.1/ 246 Georgian Bar Association members trained in ADR (61% women) 2.2/ Regional University for piloting ADR course is identified – Batumi State University and Kutaisi State University. The Model syllabus will be elaborated in 2020 in cooperation with these universities. 2.3.1. at least 30% of Civil Law Chamber l law specialization judges and their assistants are trained on ADR (at least 40% of trainees are women)

1.1/ The Association of Mediation established and running 1.2/ 4 Mediation centres are open in district/city courts outside Tbilisi 1.3.1/ 20% increase of awareness on ADR 1.3.2/ at least 200 cases of in-court mediation in 2020 1.3.3/ at least 7 business to business arbitration in 2020 2.1/ at least 400 GBA members are trained on ADR (at least 50% women) 2.2/ Model syllabus piloted in at least one educational institution in region 2.3.1/ at least 40 % of Civil Law Chamber judges/civil law specialization judges and their assistants are trained on ADR (at least 40% of trainees are women) 2.3.2/ At least 200 commercial cases monitored

1.1/ Mediators Association of Georgia has been established, it has elaborated Institutional Strategy 2020-2025, Communications Strategy and Mediators Certification Programme. Its office premises were equipped with the projects support to enable it to offer the space for mediation sessions for those courts that are in need. 1.2/ 4 Mediation centres have not opened yet, however the High Council of Justice has announced and completed tenders for reconstruction of the available court space and the launch of regional mediation court centers is planned for 2021. 1.3.1/ 20% increase of awareness on ADR 1.3.2/ 135 mediation cases were referred to in-court mediation centers in 2020 1.3.3/ Georgian arbitration centers have reported 5 business to business arbitration in 2020 2.1/ 625 GBA members were trained in ADR (63% women) 2.3.1/ The training of judges was postponed due to COVID-19 pandemic. The High School of Justice has requested the postponement of this activity to 2021 2.3.2/ 200 commercial cases were monitored during first phase of court-monitoring, while the second phase is ongoing with additional 200 cases to be monitored.

1.1/ The Association of Mediation established and running 1.2/ 4 Mediation centres are open in district/city courts outside Tbilisi 1.3.1/ 20% increase of awareness on ADR 1.3.2/ at least 200 cases of in-court mediation in 2020 1.3.3/ at least 7 business to business arbitration in 2020 2.1/ at least 400 GBA members are trained on ADR (at least 50% women) 2.2/ Model syllabus piloted in at least one educational institution in region 2.3.1/ at least 40 % of Civil Law Chamber judges/civil law specialization judges and their assistants are trained on ADR (at least 40% of trainees are women) 2.3.2/ At least 200 commercial cases monitored

1.1/ Mediators Association of Georgia has been established, it has elaborated Institutional Strategy 2020-2025, Communications Strategy and Mediators Certification Programme. Its office premises were equipped with the projects support to enable it to offer the space for mediation sessions for those courts that are in need. 1.2/ 4 Mediation centres have not opened yet, however the High Council of Justice has announced and completed tenders for reconstruction of the available court space and the launch of regional mediation court centers is planned for 2021. 1.3.1/ 20% increase of awareness on ADR 1.3.2/ 135 mediation cases were referred to in-court mediation centers in 2020 1.3.3/ Georgian arbitration centers have reported 5 business to business arbitration in 2020 2.1/ 756 GBA members were trained in ADR (63% women) 2.3.1/ 70 judges and 56 clerks capacity was enhanced in ADR (more than 70% of trainees were women) 2.3.2/ 400 commercial cases were monitored during two phase of court-monitoring.
